Something is wrong with the aspect ratio. Eyes and car wheels in the sample I downloaded are not circles but ovals. It is a slight deformation, but it really bugs me.

People, if you download a movie and the aspect ratio is wrong (happens pretty frequently), it takes 5 minutes or less to fix it PERMANENTLY, or you can fix it instantly (but temporarily) much of the time if you're using the VLC player.  To fix it temporarily, just open the VIDEO tab in VLC and select the desired aspect ratio from the options provided (the most common ones are there).  To fix it permanently, simply open the file using MKV Merge or Yamb (Google them), select the video track, specify the desired aspect ratio, and spit out the new file (IMDB has all the theatrical aspect ratios listed, and those are usually correct for the rips).  MKV Merge will generate an MKV file in 2 to 3 minutes.  Yamb will produce an MP4 file if that's your preference, but it takes around 5 minutes usually depending on the file size.  You DON'T have to spend hours re-encoding the video!  Please stop complaining about incorrect aspect ratios, it's a non-issue.
